description: This walk traverses the full length of the Royal National Park along the Lady Carrington Drive, while the walk to the start of the historic road is an adventure of its own.

markers.description: Get the train to Waterfall using transportnsw.info.
Exit the station to the left and find the trailhead across the carpark.
From the carpark follow the Couranga Walking Track.
Follow the left side of the oval clearing.
From the clearing, pass the gate and follow Uloola Firetrail to the left.
From the right side of the trail follow the sign to Bola Creek.
Follow the trail to the right along the creek.
Follow the trail along the right bank of the Hacking River.
Look for the sandy crossing down the left side of the track.
At the river crossing use the step stones to cross to the sandy beach on the other side.
+2km If the crossing is impossible, continue following the Couranga Track.
Cross Waterfall Creek and continue following the Couranga Track on the other side.
From the trailhead CAREFULLY follow the shoulder of McKell Ave to the left.
Be mindful of traffic when crossing the bridge over the Hacking River.
After the bridge follow the sign to Wattamolla to the left.
From the left side of the road follow the sign to the Forest Path to the Couranga Track.
From the intersection with the Couranga Track continue straight on the Forest Path.
From the other side of the Hacking River follow the steps up at the No Pushbikes sign.
At the intersection follow the sign left to Audley down the Forest Path.
At Bola Creek, follow Lady Carrington Drive left towards Audley.
+3km From the right side of the track there is a possible side track to the Limestone Cave.
On the left side of the track the Calala picnic area offers picnic tables to rest at.
A spring to rest your horses, or just your legs.
markers.title: Fill Her Up
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: Finish the paved section of Lady Carrington Drive along the picnic areas to Audley.
From the bridge continue to the Visitor Centre.
The Audley Dance Hall offers amenities.
Follow the path from the visitor centre to the carpark.
From the carpark follow the footpath to the left to the weir.
From the other side of the weir, cross Audley Rd into the Bus Stop Flat Picnic Area.
There is a toilet block near the picnic area.
Follow the Honeymoon Track up the ridge from the left side of the toilet block.
At the top of the ridge follow the footpath past the park office.
Cross the road into the carpark and continue to the tram platform.
Check www.sydneytramwaymuseum.com.au if the historical tramway operates today.
From the end of the platform follow Rawson Pde Trail along the tram line.
Follow the trail the right around the park depot.
From the end of the depot fence line, follow the Loftus Loop Track to the right.
At the split in the trail follow the the bike trail left along the Princess Hwy. Watch out for cyclists.
The bike trail end at the traffic lights near Loftus Station.
Use the traffic lights to cross the Princess Hwy safely.
Across the highway enter the carpark at the Tramway Museum.
Cross the carpark to Loftus Station.
Plan your return trip from Loftus at transportnsw.info.
+2km If time allows, consider following Old Princes Highway to Sutherland for a more frequent train service.
Follow the footpath along the sports fields.
From the Leisure Centre, follow the footpath along Old Princess Hwy under the overpass to the shops.
From the shops, cross the road to Sutherland Station.
Plan your return trip from Loftus at transportnsw.info.
